instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2849: What is 820-2849? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message: Hi need some advice, board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> acting strange. need to find out where its shorted to ground. If i take RC215 off then pin 2 shows beautiful 5.02V and pin 1=2.27v , what i dont understand where does it take 2.27v when rc215 is off  as UC240 is no stuff. As soon as i put it on 5V disappear  leaving pin 2 with 0.05V. If i inject 5.5V to pin 1 then fans starts spinning and 5v stays as if its not shorted at all nothing gets warm. any ideas where to look at?

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message: Resistance to GND on the rail?

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> shorted
macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message: Check resistance mode not diode mode although 433 doesn't seem like a short

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message: find out that something at <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_PCH</SIGNAL> end shorted to ground as two L2560 and L2565 had a crack. removed them and both pins 1 had a continuous beep 0.05 diode mode. Trying to find out what makes <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_PCH</SIGNAL> but cant find it. any suggestions.

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_PCH</SIGNAL> resistance to GND? This is a low resistance rail!

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message: Hi, found some time to play with the board again. sorted out the short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>, it was a poly tantalum capacitor. Now the board turns on, but <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> Missing. Power comes to <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> anything particular to look at ?

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message: Resistance to GND on Vcore GPU? Is <SIGNAL>EG_RAIL3_EN</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message: hi mate, where are you from duke? you're always here. glad you're always happy to help. yes mate <SIGNAL>EG_RAIL3_EN</SIGNAL> is present. vcore GPU was shorted so removed the L8920, still nothing, replaced <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>. i have 4.6V on <TRANSISTOR>Q8951</TRANSISTOR> pin5 lgate, 0 V on <TRANSISTOR>Q8950</TRANSISTOR> pin4 ugate, pins 1256 -8.6V

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> shorted
macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message: ok so the board turns on fans spin but no chime no video. if i measure voltage on <SIGNAL>PPCPUVTT_S0</SIGNAL> when board is powered on i get 1.05V so its fine, then when i measure <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> i get 0.8V and its supposed to be 1.25V right? does it mean it is shorting somewhere? most of the time when i plug charger i get green light but it doesnt start but unplug it and plug it straight away and it powers on from second time. doesnt power on from 1st attempt. when pluggged in for the first time i get 0.36V on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> so fans dont spin but unplug it and plug it straight away and fans start to spin with 5V on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>. Resistance to ground on L7425=051 is it normal? thanks for your time duke

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> shorted
threads.message:
Resistance to ground on L7425=051 

I have no idea what 051 is. Also need to know resistance to GND on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> if that rail is not present.
